results.title: The Mystery of Oberwald = Il Mistero Di Oberwald
results.brief_description: Since her husband’s death ten years ago the Queen has been mournful, reclusive and obsessed with her own death. She offers refuge for three days to a man who attempts to kill her: she warns him ‘ If you do not kill me, I’ll kill you’. However, he bears a ghost-like resemblance to the dead king and quickly her passion and love for life is rekindled. The final twist in this remarkable picture will leave you drenched with compassion and only then will you know the mystery of Oberwald. From the play by Jean Cocteau.

results.title: The Serpent's Egg
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Dino De Laurentiis and Rialto Film
results.brief_description: Berlin is at boiling point! Money is worthless and fear rules! Through the chaotic madness two people battle to keep their sanity… but what they uncover is far more dangerous than degradation and starvation…the human guinea pigs who risk insanity and death for a square meal. Starring Liv Ullman, David Carradine and James Whitmore.

results.title: The Time to Live and the Time to Die = Tong Nien Wang Shi
results.creator_credit: Xiaoxian Hou and Central Motion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: The Time to Live and the Time to Die is the story of a boy in the early 1950’s, baffled by all the grown-up’s talk of “home” on the mainland, unmoved by the portentous news stories that come over the radio; the story of a teenage delinquent in the early 1960s, thrown out of school, getting into fights with rival gangs, feeling the first stirring’s of sexual curiosity. It is Hou’s own voice that speaks the narration at the beginnings and end, confirming the intimacy and the candour of these memories. But this is also the story of a generation, the generation that fled from the hardships of China in the late 1940s, settled in the comparative prosperity of Taiwan and then found itself unable to return. It’s a story never before told on film, and certainly never visualised in such piercing and accurate detail. This has nothing to do with nostalgia. It is founded on a warm but clear-eyed sensitivity to the ways that people talk, think and behave. The result is one of the greatest Chinese films ever made.

results.title: The Postman always rings twice
results.creator_credit: Tay Garnett, Carey Wilson, Haworth Productions and ITC
results.brief_description: A beautiful woman involves her lover in a scheme to get rid of her much older husband. Lana Turner and John Garfield are excitingly partnered for a tense, even clinical drama of a crime of passion. Based on the novel by James M. Cain.

results.title: Money movers
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Matt Carroll and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An armoured payroll van is attacked and robbed but this is merely an overture to a much larger multi-dollar theft by the members of a security company. Based on an actual incident and adapted from a book by Devon Minchin. Stars Bryan Brown, Terence Donovan and Tony Bonner.

results.title: Midnite spares
results.creator_credit: Quentin Masters, Tom Burstall and Filmco
results.brief_description: A group of criminals strip cars for their parts and are involved in a kidnapping. When the man’s son returns home after a long absence, he embarks on a chaotic rescue mission with the help of a few friends. Stars James Laurie, Gia Carides, Max Cullen and Bruce Spence.

results.title: The Mango tree
results.creator_credit: Kevin Dobson, Michael Pate and Pisces Productions
results.brief_description: Jamie’s life is touched by all the experiences around him; he sees how a seemingly hopeless drunk can be a man of wisdom and an unforgettable friend; how a sadistic teacher can vent all his pent-up hatred on one unfortunate boy; how a “man of God”, trapped by his own sense of righteousness can turn brutally and commit murder; how people can join forces in times of utmost need, or turn against that which they don’t know or understand. Based on the novel by Ronald McKie. Stars Christopher Pate, Geraldine Fitzgerald, Robert Helpmann and Gerard Kennedy.

results.title: Mad Max: beyond thunderdome
results.creator_credit: George Ogilvie, George Miller, Byron Kennedy and Kennedy Miller Productions
results.brief_description: Mad Max continues as the hero who stands alone against barbarians of a post-nuclear age. The action is set in Bartertown, where Max arrives in search of some stolen property and has to fight a duel in the Thunderdome arena. Mel Gibson is joined by Tina Turner in the third Mad Max film. Cast also includes Helen Buday, Frank Thring, Bruce Spence, Robert Grubb, Angry Anderson.

results.title: Libido
results.creator_credit: David Baker, Fred Schepisi, Tim Burstall, John B Murray and Producers and Directors Guild of Australia
results.brief_description: Libido is a motivating force that guides, directs and even shares a personality. The film’s scope encompasses four people of distinctly different backgrounds - a husband, a child, a family man and a priest. Each is dealt within a separate piece directed by four different filmmakers. Scriptwriters include Hal Porter, Thomas Kenneally and David Williamson. Cast: (The Husband) Elke Neidhardt, Bryon Williams ; (The Child) John Williams, Jill Forster ; (The Priest) Robyn Nevin, Arthur Dignam ; (The Family Man) Jack Thompson, Max Gillies.

results.title: Lady stay dead
results.brief_description: A girl visits her film star sister in a beach resort only to discover clues to a macabre murder. A psychotic gardener preys on his female employers, murdering them in a variety of grisly ways.
